definition: to take seriously/serious/No joking, really!
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at
really/truly/indeed/real/true/genuine

sentences.english: Seriously? I thought. Condoms for kids?
sentences.chinese: 此話當真？我在想。孩子用的安全套？

sentences.english: We can't take you seriously when you just bandy words.
sentences.chinese: 當你們僅僅是互相鬥嘴時我們不能當真。

sentences.english: Would you take a guy seriously if he wore shorts to the office?
sentences.chinese: 一個穿着短褲在辦公室裏的男人，你會把他當真嗎？

sentences.english: And of course, no one took him seriously.
Pious Master Dimmesdale! can this be you?
sentences.chinese: 虔誠的丁梅斯代爾牧師，難道當真是你嗎？

sentences.english: And if you really enjoy a tip?
sentences.chinese: 你當真非常喜歡這個建議麼？

sentences.english: LAURA: We handled all the advertising and promotion for the Fair.
sentences.chinese: 我們當真萬博會掃數的告白與宣傳促銷。

sentences.english: My curse Shu really is that does the white do?
sentences.chinese: 我的詛咒術當真是白練的嗎？

sentences.english: If anybody really believed the things I did on stage, they wouldn't clap, they'd scream.
sentences.chinese: 如果大家把我的表演當真，就不會鼓掌，只會尖叫。

sentences.english: They love to boast, though often with tongue in cheek. P. 3
sentences.chinese: 他們喜歡吹噓自詡，儘管往往是半開玩笑，不可當真。

sentences.english: What he said was just rant . Don't take it seriously.
sentences.chinese: 他所說的是誇誇其談，不要當真。

sentences.english: The crowd laughed, but the president was serious.
sentences.chinese: 觀衆笑了起來，可總統卻是當真的。

sentences.english: The 21st century, can I take it seriously as Shamo?
sentences.chinese: 21世紀裏，能把我當真看成傻冒嗎？

sentences.english: If the Senator really used the best security outfitters, that doesn't seem likely.
sentences.chinese: 如果議員當真裝配了最先進的保安系統，就不會那樣。

sentences.english: Is difficult don't transform him truly is what steel does?
sentences.chinese: 難不成他當真是鐵做的？

sentences.english: If this be the case, he deserves you.
sentences.chinese: 當真這樣，他的確配得上你。

definition: to play a joke/to make fun of/to joke
a modal particle indicating (don't mind it, ok)
a modal particle indicating (that's all, only, nothing much)
that's right/sure!/rest assured!/that's good/can't go wrong
to say again/to put off a discussion until later/moreover/what's more/besides
to bother about/to haggle/to bicker/to argue/plan/stratagem
excessive/undue/overly
to be indifferent/not to matter/cannot be said to be
don't tell me .../could it be that...?
to think (i.e. to take it to be true that ...) (Usually there is an implication that the notion is mistaken – except when expressing one's own current opinion.)
as it should be by rights (idiom); proper and to be expected as a matter of course/inevitable and right
moreover/besides/in addition/furthermore
joke/jest/CL:個|个[ge4]/to laugh at/to mock
lit. that person/fig. the person you have been looking for/Mr Right/the girl of one's dreams
to feel embarrassed or awkward/to make things difficult (for someone)/to find things difficult (to do or manage)
perhaps/maybe
(it's) no wonder (that...)/(it's) not surprising (that)
